did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Suffragists Oral History Project oral histories
did.abstract: Oral History transcripts of twelve suffragists, conducted by the Bancroft Library, University of California at Berkeley from 1959 to 1977.

scopecontent.p: The Suffragist Oral History Project was undertaken by the Bancroft Library, University of California at Berkeley from 1959 to 1977. Its purpose was to record for posterity the life stories of women who experienced directly the struggle for women's rights and equality in the 20th century. The collection consists of transcripts of the following interviews:

p.title: Helen Valeska Bary: Labor Administration and Social Security, a Woman's Life
Sarah Bard Field: Poet and Suffragist
Burnita Shelton Matthews: Pathfinder in the Legal Aspects of Women
Jeanette Rankin: Activist for World Peace, Women's Rights and Democratic Government
Rebecca Hourwich Reyher: Search and Struggle for Equality and Independence
Mabel Vernon: Speaker for Suffrage and Petitioner for Peace

scopecontent.p:
Suffragists From Tea Parties to Prison, includes:
Sylvie G. Thompson Shygeson: In the Parlor
Jessie Haver Butler: On the Platform
Miriam Allen deFord: In the Streets
Laura Ellesworth Seiler: On the Soapbox
Ernestine H. Kettler: Behind Bars
NOTE: There is no container list for this collection. Contact the Sophia Smith Collection for more information.

accessrestrict.p: The papers are open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection.

userestrict.p: Published by Bancroft Library, Regional Oral History Office. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights. Permission to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use" must also be obtained from the Sophia Smith Collection as owners of the physical property.

altformavail.head: Additional Formats
altformavail.p: The entire Suffragists Oral History Project is now freely available online. Also available on microfilm: "University of California, Berkeley suffragists oral history collection (1-12) [microform]"

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Suffragists Oral History Collection, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.
